## Career Goals

I'm transitioning from operations into data analytics, combining my finance background with advanced analytics training from Boston University's Master's program. I'm particularly drawn to data analyst and data scientist roles where I can uncover insights through rigorous research and statistical modeling.

What drives me is the investigative side of analytics; diving deep into messy datasets, asking the right questions during exploratory analysis, and transforming raw data into meaningful patterns. My data mining coursework solidified this passion, teaching me to approach problems systematically: from feature engineering and cleaning to building predictive models that actually tell a story.

My ideal role would leverage both my operational foundation; validating complex datasets, ensuring data integrity, automating workflows and my technical skills in Python, SQL, and machine learning. I'm especially interested in marketing analytics or research-focused teams where thorough data exploration directly shapes strategic decisions.
